meanings.definition: To act as an uncle to someone.
meanings.sent1: My neighbor likes to unclew his friend's children when they visit.
meanings.sent2: He unclews his niece by taking her to the park every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to unclew the kitten by playing fetch with it.
meanings.sent4: She unclews the new students by showing them around the school.
meanings.sent5: The kind man always unclews the orphans in the neighborhood by giving them gifts.

meanings.definition: To be related as an uncle to someone.
meanings.sent1: I unclew my cousin's children, even though we live far apart.
meanings.sent2: He unclews his nephew by attending all his baseball games.
meanings.sent3: The family reunion unclewed many distant relatives.
meanings.sent4: Their close bond unclews them, even though they are not blood relatives.
meanings.sent5: The family tree unclews the connections between all the cousins.
